Class TypingProfile

  • java.lang.Object
    • TypingProfile

  • public class TypingProfile
extends java.lang.Object
    A typing profile captures the "fingerprint" of the user's typing and can be used to identify a user at a later date.
    Author:
    Thomas DeRensis

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TypingProfile(java.lang.String name)
      Constructor creates a profile with the given name.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      long getAvgLeftShiftDuration()
      Get the average time that the left shift key was pressed down.
      long getAvgRightShiftDuration()
      Get the average time that the right shift key was pressed down.

      Get a map of string statistics mapped to common words.

      Get an array of common words being recorded.

      Get the number of times the left shift key was pressed.

      Get the name of the profile.

      Returns a rating between 0 and 1.

      String representation of the profile;
      void updateAverageCommonWordDuration(StringStats ss)
      Updates the average time it took to type a common word.
      void updateAveragePairDuration(StringStats ss)
      Updates the average time it took to type a pair of characters.
      void updateAverageSingleDuration(char c, long time)
      Updates the average that a given character has been pressed
      void updateLeftShift(char c, long time)
      Updates the left shift count, average duration, and keeps track of whether the user is using the correct shift for each character.
      void updateRightShift(char c, long time)
      Updates the right shift count, average duration, and keeps track of whether the user is using the correct shift for each character.
